dataManagement

Class Document

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataManagement.Document
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<dataManagement.WordInDocument>

    public class Document
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<dataManagement.WordInDocument>
    This is the type of object that represents a document. A document is associated to a file whose content is the document. It allows important operations on the document content: to display the document's content, to read valid words from the document, to iterate over words in the document, to iterate over lines in the document, ... Useful when a new document is being indexed and when the content of a document needs to be displayed. (NOT NECESSARILY COMPLETE...)
    Author:
    pedroirivera-vega

    • Constructor Detail

      • Document

        public Document(java.io.RandomAccessFile file)
        Creates a new instance of Document. The document this object represents is the one whose content is at the specified file. This is useful when the document is being added to the index.
        Parameters:
        file - the document's content.

      • Document

        public Document(int docID)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                java.io.IOException
        Creates a new instance of Document. The document that this instance represents is the one whose ID is given as parameter. This method presumes that the document already has an ID assigned.
        Parameters:
        docID - the ID of the corresponding document
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - invalid id
        java.io.IOException - input or output error with files

      • displayDocumentContent

        public void displayDocumentContent(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> wp,
                                   int nLines)
        Displays the current content of the the first lines of a document, where that number is given as parameter. If that number is <= 0, then the whole document will be displayed. It underlines words beginning at positions listed in wp and which appear on any of the lines being displayed.
        Parameters:
        wp - ordered list of positions (indexes) where a word begins and which needs to be underlined (or somehow emphasized) in displayed output. This list must be in increasing order of its values.
        nLines - the number of lines to display. A value 0 or less causes the whole document to be displayed; otherwise, it displays the first nLines lines from the document.

      • readNextWordFromFile

        public dataManagement.WordInDocument readNextWordFromFile()
                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        The following method reads the next word from the document's file at or after the current location in the file. A valid word in this case is any maximal sequence of letters.
        Returns:
        WordInDocument object containing the word and its location. null if no more words are found in the document from the current location.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • iterator

        public java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> lineIterable()

        Returns:
        Iterable that allows iteration over lines in the document.
